item.title: By: Greg
item.dc:creator: Greg
item.description: I've been going through all these flickr shots from this event. Looks fun. I wish I lived closer to things like this. My city is so devoid of any good tech, its hard enough to get a decent job in the industry. Plans on moving to Seattle area - perhaps that will help propel me into the industry a bit more.
item.content:encoded: I’ve been going through all these flickr shots from this event. Looks fun. I wish I lived closer to things like this. My city is so devoid of any good tech, its hard enough to get a decent job in the industry. Plans on moving to Seattle area – perhaps that will help propel me into the industry a bit more.

item.title: By: What Bloggers Had To Say About BarCamp DC « Oatmeal Stout - Justin Thorp’s Web 2.0 blog
item.dc:creator: What Bloggers Had To Say About BarCamp DC « Oatmeal Stout - Justin Thorp’s Web 2.0 blog
item.description: [...] Russell Heimlich “There were so many interested attendees that many had to be turned away at the door. Wow! I guess the DC tech community has been secretly yearning for a BarCamp to pop up in the area… I had a blast at BarCamp DC and can’t wait until they hold another one (I think I heard the next one would be in January), hopefully in a bigger space. I already know what my next topic will be.” [...]
item.content:encoded: […] Russell Heimlich “There were so many interested attendees that many had to be turned away at the door. Wow! I guess the DC tech community has been secretly yearning for a BarCamp to pop up in the area… I had a blast at BarCamp DC and can’t wait until they hold another one (I think I heard the next one would be in January), hopefully in a bigger space. I already know what my next topic will be.” […]

item.title: By: Jared Goralnick
item.dc:creator: Jared Goralnick
item.description:
Thanks for a great Firebug presentation--sorry you had to use a Windows laptop. I agree with your sentiments on the event--the DC tech community really benefited from this and I think this is going to be the start of something wonderful.
Keep up the blogging and good work!
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for a great Firebug presentation–sorry you had to use a Windows laptop. I agree with your sentiments on the event–the DC tech community really benefited from this and I think this is going to be the start of something wonderful.

Keep up the blogging and good work!
